We need to produce summary, business_intent, keywords list. Based on file description: sample/migrate_rt.py seems to be a sample script for migrating refresh tokens? The docstring shows configuration JSON with authority, client_id, scope. It mentions running sample with JSON config file. Imports include msal (Microsoft Authentication Library). So the script likely obtains tokens using MSAL, maybe migrates refresh tokens from elsewhere. There's a function get_preexisting_rt_and_their_scopes_from_elsewhere which is a standard getter.

Thus summary: This module demonstrates how to use MSAL to acquire tokens based on a configuration file, possibly migrating existing refresh tokens and scopes. It reads a JSON config, sets up MSAL client, obtains tokens, and handles existing refresh tokens.

Business intent: Provide a sample utility for developers to migrate or manage refresh tokens using Microsoft identity platform, showing how to configure authority, client ID, scopes, and run via command line.

Keywords: MSAL, Microsoft Graph, authentication, refresh token migration, JSON configuration, command-line sample, token acquisition, OAuth2, Azure AD.
